alert.note: Alert for Belmont; Carroll (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 16 at 3:47PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT WESTERN HARRISON...EASTERN GUERNSEY...EAST CENTRAL COSHOCTON...SOUTHWESTERN CARROLL... NORTHWESTERN BELMONT AND TUSCARAWAS COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 346 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Farmerstown to near Byesville. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Philadelphia, Dover, Cambridge, Uhrichsville, Freeport, Newcomerstown, Dennison, Strasburg, Byesville, Sugarcreek, Gnadenhutten, and Antrim. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Ohio between mile markers 180 and 197. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 39 and 94. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
